metadataAttributes.Title: Visual Elements of User Interface Design
metadataAttributes.Short Intro: This design-centric course examines the broad question of what an interface is and what role a designer plays in creating a user interface. Learning how to design and articulate meaning using color, type, and imagery is essential to making interfaces function clearly and seamlessly. Through a series of lectures and visual exercises, you will focus on the many individual elements and components that make up the skillset of an interface designer. By the end of this course, you will be able to describe the key formal elements of clear, consistent, and intuitive UI design, and apply your learned skills to the design of a static screen-based interface.
metadataAttributes.Skills: User Interface Design (UI Design),User Experience (UX),Graphic Design,
